abstract: Sprint Nextel on Wednesday sold $6.5 billion worth of high-yield bonds, breaking the record for the single biggest noninvestment-grade offering ever sold directly to investors. The sale comes only days after Verizon announced that it has taken out $61 billion in financing to support its mammoth deal to buy full control of its wireless unit.
snippet: Sprint Nextel on Wednesday sold $6.5 billion worth of high-yield bonds, breaking the record for the single biggest noninvestment-grade offering ever sold directly to investors. The sale comes only days after Verizon announced that it has taken out...
lead_paragraph: For setting records for the debt markets, it appears that telecommunications companies can’t be beat.

headline.main: Sprint Breaks Record With Big New Bond Offering

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Bailouts were necessary in 2008 to keep the financial system operating, but it is now more important than ever to distinguish why that was important.
snippet: Bailouts were necessary in 2008 to keep the financial system operating, but it is now more important than ever to distinguish why that was important.
lead_paragraph: Five years ago, as Lehman Brothers teetered, there was remarkably little concern about what would happen if it failed and virtually none about what would happen to the rest of Wall Street if it did.

headline.main: The Perils When Megabanks Lose Focus
headline.print_headline: The Perils When Megabanks Lose Focus

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
